text:
the documentroot section (at least) of the docs fails to mention that where 
path names contain spaces they need to be enclosed in talking marks (") The 
windows install httpd.conf file gives examples that suggests in the examples 
that talking marks are needed, but no specific comment in the httpd.conf file 
or the online documentation that I can find. 

I specificaly got tripped up while configuring virtual hosts. by entering in :-

    DocumentRoot e:/aa all webs/tvs

when i should have entered 
    DocumentRoot "e:/aa all webs/tvs"

I had used the talking marks in my main server config section, but it never 
occured that they where required.

thanks

If you clicked on the "syntax" heading in that directive you would see this:
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/directive-dict.html#Syntax

In general, for any directive, any argument that contains a space must be
surrounded in quotation marks.  We include that instruction in the "syntax"
docs, because it wouldn't make sense to note it in every single directive
description.
